verse.roman:
so 'py evaṁ kopito 'riṣṭaḥ
khureṇāvanim ullikhan
udyat-puccha-bhraman-meghaḥ
kruddhaḥ kṛṣṇam upādravat

synonyms: saḥ—he; api—indeed; evam—in this way; kopitaḥ—angered; ariṣṭaḥ—Ariṣṭa; khureṇa—with his hoof; avanim—the earth; ullikhan—scratching; udyat—raised; puccha—within his tail; bhraman—wandering; meghaḥ—clouds; kruddhaḥ—furious; kṛṣṇam—toward Lord Kṛṣṇa; upādravat—he charged.
translation: Thus provoked, Ariṣṭa pawed the ground with one of his hooves and then, with the clouds hovering around his upraised tail, furiously charged Kṛṣṇa.
